result.execSummary:
The defendant Jermarco O Thomas was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Bail Jumping-Felony, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(b).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
The court ordered that all court costs, fines, surcharges be paid through collection by the Department of Corrections due no later than 8-5-2024. Any amount remaining due and owing is subject to civil judgment.
Pay all court costs, assessments and victim/witness surcharges.
Provide a DNA sample for the Data Bank and pay all appropriate costs.

The defendant is advised as a convicted felon he/she may not carry or possess any firearms/body armor.
The defendant is advised that voting rights are suspended during the length of sentence.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Jermarco O Thomas

records.addlTxt: Received and Filed. Pretrial Incarceration Credit

Defendant Jermarco O Thomas in court with attorney Colin Patrick McGinn.  Defendant Jermarco O Thomas in custody.  Mallory R Davis appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Deputy Court Clerk: STW
Case set for Sentencing Hearing.  Statements by each counsel and defendant as to sentencing. 

AS TO COUNT 1: Court sentenced the defendant to serve 88 DAYS in the House of Correction; with credit for 88 DAYS served.  A TIME SERVED DISPOSITION

The Court ordered that all court costs, fines, surcharges be paid through collection by the Department of Corrections due no later than 8-5-2024.  Any amount remaining due and owing is subject to civil judgment.
Pay all court costs, assessments and victim/witness surcharges.
Provide a DNA sample for the Data Bank and pay all appropriate costs.

The defendant is advised as a convicted felon he/she may not carry or possess any firearms/body armor.
The defendant is advised that voting rights are suspended during length of sentence.

The defendant is advised of his/her appeal rights by defense counsel.

Attorney Colin Patrick McGinn in court, defendant Jermarco O Thomas not in court, in custody.  Mallory R Davis appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk: STW  
Case set for Sentencing hearing.  Parties request an adjournment as the defendant was not produced for today's hearing. Case adjourned, branch 38.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for August 2, 2022 at 08:15 am.
Received and Filed. Ineligible Voting Form
Received and Filed. Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief

Defendant Jermarco O Thomas in court with attorney Colin Patrick McGinn.  Defendant Jermarco O Thomas in custody.  Mallory R Davis appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Case in court for Plea Hearing.

Parties have reached an agreement. State places offer on the record. Defense and defendant are in agreement.

As to Count 1: Defendant changes plea to GUILTY. Defendant examined as to plea, advised of Constitutional Rights and the maximum penalties. Defendant further advised that if not a US citizen, deportation is possible. Court found that the defendant knowingly, voluntarily and intelligently waived rights.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights form, Addendum, and Elements/Jury Instructions received and filed. Parties stipulate to the Criminal Complaint as a factual basis to sustain defendant's plea.  Court found defendant GUILTY and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered on the record.  

*Court advised due to felony conviction the defendant is prohibited from firearm possession, and defendant's voting rights are suspended and may not vote until civil rights are restored.

Court vacates 08/16/2022 sentencing date and adjourned case to Branch 38 for Sentencing.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for July 29, 2022 at 08:15 am.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for July 29, 2022 at 08:15 am.
Email correspondence with parties. Court is in trial on another matter and unable to hear case. Case re-scheduled for Plea Hearing on 07/27/2022 at 03:30 pm, Br 29.
Plea Questionnaire Waiver of Rights and Addendum, filed.

CASE HEARD FOR BR. 29:
Defendant Jermarco O Thomas in court with attorney Colin Patrick McGinn.  Defendant Jermarco O Thomas in custody.  Adam Joseph Best appeared for the State of Wisconsin. PARTIES APPEAR BY VIDEO.  
Preliminary hearing proceeded.  Sworn for the State: Detective Anna Ojdana - MPD.  Court took judicial notice of defendant's pending matter regarding case 18CF963. State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Original information received and filed;  defendant given a copy, waived reading, was arraigned in open court and plead not guilty.  Case is adjourned to Branch 29.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for August 16, 2022 at 02:30 pm.

Defendant Jermarco O Thomas not in court, defendant in custody.  Mallory R Davis appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Case set for a preliminary hearing.  Matter held via Zoom video conference and streamed through DAcast. Attorney McGinn is unavailable today to conduct the preliminary hearing. Court finds CAUSE to adjourn the preliminary hearing.  Case is adjourned to Br. PE.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for June 17, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION Level 4.

Defendant Jermarco O Thomas in court with attorney Joel Alan Mogren.  Defendant Jermarco O Thomas in custody.  David T. Malone appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Jermarco O Thomas appeared by video means with Attorney.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Kiefer Branch 29.  Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  
This hearing may be streamed live at the discretion of the Court via https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/c105c3fe-89b8-5d05-5f8c-b6cf0d4921da  Preliminary hearing scheduled for June 6, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

ADDRESS INFO for Jermarco O Thomas
Current: 2360 N 53rd St, Milwaukee, WI 53210   (Effective: 05-24-2022)
Prior: 3122 North 35th Street, Milwaukee, WI 53216
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
